revision.comment: /* Early life and education */ Moved content to career section. Added downsized version to intro.
revision.text:
[[File:Dieter Nuhr, 2017.jpg|thumb|Dieter Nuhr in January 2017]] [[File:Dieter Nuhr signature.svg|thumb|Signature of Dieter Nuhr]]
'''Dieter Herbert Nuhr''' (born October 29, 1960 in [[Wesel]], [[North Rhine-Westphalia]]) is a [[Germany|German]] [[comedy|comedian]],<ref>{{cite web|title=Comedy |url=http://www1.wdr.de/fernsehen/unterhaltung/comedy/indexcomedy100.html|website=[[Westdeutscher Rundfunk|WDR]]}}</ref> carbaret artist, author and television presenter.
Nuhr's stage program ''nuhr in Berlin'' (the title is a pun; for explanation, [[Dieter Nuhr#CD albums|see below]]) is the first German stand-up comedy which was created exclusively for [[Netflix]].<ref name=":0">{{cite web|url=http://www.berliner-zeitung.de/kultur/medien/nuhr-auf-netflix-24876994|title=Nuhr auf Netflix|date=2016-10-10|website=berliner-zeitung.de|language=German|access-date=2016-11-15}}</ref><ref name=":1">{{cite web|url=http://www.focus.de/kultur/kino_tv/dieter-nuhr-netflix-bringt-dieter-nuhr-weltweit-auf-die-bildschirme_id_6051975.html|title=Netflix bringt Dieter Nuhr weltweit auf die Bildschirme|date=2016-10-10|website=focus.de|language=German|access-date=2016-11-10}}</ref>
== Early life and education == Nuhr was born in [[Wesel]] but his family moved to [[Düsseldorf]] when he was four years old. Growing up he attended the secondary school Leibniz-Gymnasium.
In 1981 he started to study art and history at the [[University of Duisburg-Essen]] and received his teaching degree in 1988. From 1981 to 1989, Nuhr studied art and history at the [[Folkwang Hochschule]] in [[Essen, Germany|Essen]].
== Life and career == His first appearance on stage was with a school theater group where he also started to write his first own texts. In 1986, he and Frank Küster founded the cabaret-duo V.E.V.-K.Barett. Their first official appearance on stage was part of their program called “Haben Sie sich ihre Schranknummer gemerkt?”, which can be translated as “Have you memorized your locker-number?”. In 1987, he appeared for the first time as a cabarettist. In 1989, the duo developed their second stage program “Pralle Pracht” (lit. bulging opulence) and after a name change in 1990 to V.E.V.Kabarett the duo performed their third stage program “Schrille Stille” (lit. sharp silence). The last project of the group called “Zipfeltreffen”, which is a play on words in German (Gipfeltreffen = summit conference whereas Zipfeltreffen = summit of dicks), followed.<ref>{{cite web|last1=Küster|first1=Frank|title=Vita|url=http://www.frankkuester.de/Vita.html|website= [http://frankkuester.de/Seite_1.html Frank Küster]|accessdate=2014-10-31}}</ref><ref>{{cite web|last1=Küster|first1=Frank|title=Wie alles anfing (Plakat-Vita)|url=http://www.frankkuester.de/Plakat.html |website= [http://frankkuester.de/Seite_1.html Frank Küster]|accessdate=2014-10-31}}</ref> In 1994, Nuhr started his first solo-project called “Nuhr am Nörgeln” (This program title contains, like most of Nuhr's titles, two different meanings. It could be literally translated as "just grumbling" or as "Mr. Nuhr is grumbling" because the German word "nur", which looks similar to Nuhr's last name means "just"). From 1982 to 1992, he was an active [[artist]], and several of his works were exhibited in the [[Rhineland]]. He has since gained notoriety for his numerous television appearances on [[Die Harald Schmidt Show]], Genial daneben, Schillerstraße, [[Quatsch Comedy Club]] (Channel Pro7) and [[7 Tage, 7 Köpfe]] (lit. 7 days, 7 heads) on the channel [[RTL Television|RTL]].
In an interview with the newspaper [[Westdeutsche Zeitung]] in 2006, Nuhr was asked how he had developed his unique style: “I started my solo career because the manager of a [[Theater Krefeld und Mönchengladbach|theater in Mönchengladbach]] had talked me into it. He allowed me to perform on his stage and directed me. While I was practicing my program more and more requisites went missing because he took more and more of them away. So when the day of my first performance came close there were no requisites left anymore. I just stood there and talked to the audience. This is how my very own style was born. At first I thought that this could not work at all, but the fewer requisites I used, the better it finally worked out for me. So I thought that this is what I should do: not use any requisites but talk to the audience in my very own style.” (28 January 2006).
In 1998, the stage program “Nuhr weiter so” (lit. "Simply go on") received an award: the Deutsche Kleinkunstpreis in the category cabaret and in 2003, he received the [[Deutscher Comedypreis]] (German comedy award) for best live performance, making him the only person who received both of these well-known German awards.
Nuhr is one of the most successful cabaret artists in Germany, with more than 200.000 viewers per year. Nuhr is regarded as a mediator between ''classical'' comedy and ''intelligent'' [[Stand-up comedy]]. In his work, he gives a critical glance to social behaviour in society and media, often satirising relationships and families. Nuhr has also been known to caricature the typical German know-it-all. A typical example is his famous saying that is frequently quoted in [[web forum|forums]] and [[Newsgroups]] due to its very provocative nature: "''Wenn man keine Ahnung hat: Einfach mal Fresse halten''", which translates to, "''If you have no idea: just keep your mouth shut for once.''" His performance “Ich bin’s Nuhr” was visited by approximately half a million people. After presenting a humorous review of the year’s events in 2004,<ref>{{cite web|title=Nuhr – Der Jahresrückblick|url=http://www.wunschliste.de/serie/nuhr-der-jahresrueckblick |website=[http://www.wunschliste.de/main TV Wunschliste]}}</ref> he has been broadcast on [[ZDF]] with a similar TV show at the end of every following year.<ref>{{cite web|title=NUHR 2008|url=http://www.zdf.de/ZDFde/inhalt/25/0,1872,7496857,00.html |website=[[ZDF]]}}</ref> Nuhr presented the [[Deutscher Comedypreis|German comedy award]] for the first time on 24 October 2008 and did so over the course of the following five years.<ref>{{cite web|last1=Voß|first1=Jochen|title=Comedypreis für "Heute Show", Cindy und Nuhr|url=http://www.dwdl.de/nachrichten/23168/comedypreis_fr_heute_show_cindy_und_nuhr/ |website=[http://www.dwdl.de/home/ DWDL.de]|accessdate=2009-10-24}}</ref> Since 3 October 2009 his four-part comedy series has been shown live on ZDF on four Tuesday evenings.<ref>{{cite web|title=Nuhr so|url=http://nuhrso.zdf.de/|website=[[ZDF]]|deadurl=yes|archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20091129215906/http://nuhrso.zdf.de/|archivedate=2009-11-29|df=}}</ref><ref>{{cite web|title=Nuhr so|url=https://www.imdb.com/title/tt1537596/ |website=[[Internet Movie Database]]}}</ref> In 2009, Nuhr was asked whether he would like to participate in the album ”A Tribute to Die Fantastischen Vier” for the 20th anniversary of the group [[Die Fantastischen Vier]]. It is a compilation album with varied artists covering songs of the hip hop group from [[Stuttgart]]. Nuhr recorded the song “Buenos Dias Messias“ in his office room. In this song he played all the instruments himself and recorded it with his equipment, which he uses for radio reports otherwise.<ref>{{cite web|title=Mich fragt ja keiner!|url=http://www.kulturfalter.de/index.php?id=dieter-nuhr |website=[http://www.kulturfalter.de Kulturfalter]|accessdate=2014-10-28}}</ref><ref>{{cite web|title=A Tribute to the Fantastische Vier|url=http://www.tribute2fanta4.de/|archive-url=https://web.archive.org/web/20090719090647/http://www.tribute2fanta4.de/|dead-url=yes|archive-date=2009-07-19|website=[http://www.tribute2fanta4.de/ tribute2fanta4.de]|accessdate=2014-10-24}}</ref> In addition to that, the album includes a conversation between Nuhr and the initiator of the album project Andreas "Bär" Läsker.
From 20 January 2011 until 2014, he presented the TV show "Satire Gipfel" on [[ARD (broadcaster)|ARD]].<ref>{{cite web|title=Nuhr übernimmt „Satire Gipfel“ von Richling|url=http://www.rbb-online.de/ |website=[[Rundfunk Berlin-Brandenburg|RBB]]}}</ref> He replaced Mathias Richling, whose contract ended in 2010.<ref>{{cite web|title=Nachfolger von Mathias Richling: Dieter Nuhr erklimmt den "Satire Gipfel"|url=http://www.spiegel.de/kultur/tv/nachfolger-von-mathias-richling-dieter-nuhr-erklimmt-den-satire-gipfel-a-720077.html |website=[[Spiegel Online]]|date=28 September 2009}}</ref> In October 2014, this TV format was replaced by "Nuhr im Ersten" which was presented by him as well. Nuhr produced a two-part TV special concerning the [[2010 FIFA World Cup]]. In doing so he referred to the topic [[Association football|soccer]] in an ironical way. Furthermore, he produced weekly cabaret segments for the radio station [[WDR 2]].<ref>{{cite web|title=Es geht Nuhr nach vorn|url=http://www.wdr2.de/unterhaltung/kabarett/dieter_nuhr100.html|website=[[WDR 2]]|deadurl=yes|archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20110121221135/http://www.wdr2.de/unterhaltung/kabarett/dieter_nuhr100.html|archivedate=2011-01-21|df=}}</ref> Together with Ralph Casper he presented the quiz show "Null gewinnt" in the early evening time slot of ARD from July to March 2013. In the year 2012, Dieter Nuhr was mentor for the "ARD-Themenwoche" (a special TV format, covering a weekly particular topic) with an emphasis on the topic: living with death. To this TV format he contributed the television show "Nuhr am Leben" which was recorded in the St. Elisabeth church in Berlin Mitte and broadcast on ARD on 19 November 2012.<ref>{{cite web|title=Nuhr am Leben|url=http://programm.ard.de/TV/daserste/nuhr-am-leben/eid_281069037903991 |website=[[ARD (broadcaster)|ARD]]|accessdate=2014-10-27}}</ref> In 2013, he took part in the "ARD-Themenwoche" again, when the topic "fortunately/I'm glad that..." was concerned. His broadcast "Nuhr im Glück" was recorded in the orangery of the tropical [[Botanical Garden, Potsdam|Botanical Garden]], Potsdam and was aired on 22 November 2013.<ref>{{cite web|title= ARD-Themenwoche "Zum Glück": Nuhr im Glück|url=http://www.daserste.de/unterhaltung/comedy-satire/satire-gipfel/nuhr-im-glueck-102.html|website=[[Das Erste]]|accessdate=2014-10-27}}</ref>
The ARD-Themenwoche 2014 will be about tolerance and Nuhr will perform his stage program “Nuhr mit Respekt” (Only with respect) and will be broadcast from the [[Jewish Museum, Berlin|Jewish museum Berlin]].<ref>{{cite web|title=Nuhr mit Respekt! Von und mit Dieter Nuhr|url=http://www.rbb-online.de/fernsehen/beitrag/nuhr-mit-respekt.html|website=[[Rundfunk Berlin-Brandenburg|RBB]]|accessdate=2014-12-05|deadurl=yes|archiveurl=https://archive.is/20141205083755/http://www.rbb-online.de/fernsehen/beitrag/nuhr-mit-respekt.html|archivedate=2014-12-05|df=}}</ref> Nuhr can also be seen regularly on the TV show “Mario Barth deckt auf!” in which he and the German comedian [[Mario Barth]] show examples of projects, which only wasted tax money. In 2014, Nuhr received the Jacob-Grimm-Award. The Jury praised Nuhrs way of performing and his intelligent form of cabaret. His stage programs were eloquent and his punch lines hit. Though the main aspect of his work was not the extraordinary quality of his speeches but also his ability to perform critique with and through language and the way Nuhr invites the audience to think about how language is able to influence our thoughts and emotions.<ref>{{cite web|title=Pressemitteilung vom 15. Mai 2014|url=http://kulturpreis-deutsche-sprache.de/2014/05/pressemitteilung-vom-15-mai-2014/ |website=[http://kulturpreis-deutsche-sprache.de/ Kulturpreis Deutsche Sprache]|accessdate=2014-10-06}}</ref>
Nuhr's stage program ''nuhr in Berlin'' (the title is a pun; for explanation, [[Dieter Nuhr#CD albums|see below]]) is the first German stand-up comedy which was created exclusively for [[Netflix]].<ref name=":0" /><ref name=":1" /> On November 15, 2016, it became available on Netflix in several countries (optionally with subtitles), including the United States and the United Kingdom.
== Islamic cabaret controversy ==
Dieter Nuhr is one of the few German cabaret artists who deals with the topic of radical sides of Islam in his programmes and books.<ref>{{cite web|title=Islam-Satire – Herr Nuhr, sind Sie ein islamophober Hassprediger?|url=https://www.welt.de/politik/deutschland/article133657850/Herr-Nuhr-sind-Sie-ein-islamophober-Hassprediger.html |website=[[Die Welt]]|date=26 October 2014}}</ref> In October 2014, a suspected Salafist<ref>{{cite web|title=Hassprediger-Vorwurf – Nuhr: „Als würden Nazis für Meinungsfreiheit eintreten“|url=http://www.faz.net/aktuell/feuilleton/medien/hassprediger-vorwurf-nuhr-als-wuerden-nazis-fuer-meinungsfreiheit-eintreten-13230352.html |website=[[Frankfurter Allgemeine Zeitung]]|date=26 October 2014}}</ref> pressed charges against Nuhr because he was allegedly insulting creeds and religious communities.<ref>{{cite web|title=Dieter Nuhr wegen Islamsatire angezeigt|url=http://aktuell.evangelisch.de/artikel/110515/dieter-nuhr-wegen-islamsatire-angezeigt |website=[http://aktuell.evangelisch.de/ evangelisch.de]|publisher=EPD|accessdate=2014-10-24}}</ref> Erhat Toka (board member of the former Muslimisch Demokratischen Union – MDU, now Bündnis für Innovation und Gerechtigkeit (BIG))<ref>{{cite web|last1=Jansen|first1=Frank|title=Unter dem Deckmantel der Demokratie – Verfassungsschutz warnt vor muslimischer Partei|url=http://www.tagesspiegel.de/politik/unter-dem-deckmantel-der-demokratie-verfassungsschutz-warnt-vor-muslimischer-partei/7065948.html |website=[[Der Tagesspiegel]]|date=29 August 2012}}</ref> initiated the process and denoted Nuhr to be a hatemonger who agitates against Islam and invoked people to boycott Nuhr’s event in [[Osnabrück]]. The Islamic scholar Bülent Ucar of the [[University of Osnabrück]] argued that Nuhr uses generalizations, feeds prejudice and brings himself up to tendentious interpretations of the [[Koran]]. The emeritus professor of theology Reinhold Mokrosch who is also speaker of the Round Table of the Religions could understand the criticism of Nuhr since he felt that it encouraged [[Islamophobia]].<ref>{{cite news|last1=Lahmann-Lammert|first1=Rainer|title=Comedian als „Hassprediger“?: Muslim aus Osnabrück wirft Dieter Nuhr Hetze vor|url=http://www.noz.de/deutschland-welt/kultur/artikel/516852/muslim-aus-osnabruck-wirft-dieter-nuhr-hetze-vor |website=[[Neue Osnabrücker Zeitung]]|date=24 October 2014}}</ref> [[Aiman Mazyek]], chairman of the non-representative [[Central Council of Muslims in Germany]] was also upset about Nuhr’s utterances but advised to keep calm. Mazyek declared: "If Mr. Nuhr thinks he can interpret the Koran in a fundamentalist way for the sake of satire then he has to take responsibility for this. However, it is not worth suing him and thus giving him free advertising."<ref name=Becker>{{cite news|last1=Becker|first1=Claudia|last2=Peters|first2=Freia|title=Nuhr verwechselt Islam mit dem Islamischen Staat|url=https://www.welt.de/politik/deutschland/article133641173/Nuhr-verwechselt-Islam-mit-dem-Islamischen-Staat.html |website=[[Die Welt]]|date=24 October 2014}}</ref>
Lawyer [[Klaus Staeck]], recent president of the [[Academy of Arts, Berlin]], does not expect the complaint against the cabaret artist to be successful. Nuhr only exercises his freedom of opinion, which is taken very seriously by German courts.<ref name=Andreas>{{cite news|last1=Oswald Andreas|first1=Andreas|title=Klaus Staeck: Nicht von Fanatikern einschüchtern lassen|url=http://www.tagesspiegel.de/weltspiegel/dieter-nuhr-klaus-staeck-nicht-von-fanatikern-einschuechtern-lassen/10888100.html |website=[[Der Tagesspiegel]]|date=27 October 2014}}</ref> Nuhr objects to the accusation that he would be stirring up hatred against Islam. He would continue warning of the dangers of radical Islam, said the satirist to the [[Neue Osnabrücker Zeitung]].<ref>{{cite news|last1=Ewert|first1=Burkhard|title=Distanzierung von rechtem Zuspruch – Dieter Nuhr: Habe Islam-Diskussion nicht gewollt|url=http://www.noz.de/deutschland-welt/kultur/artikel/517315/dieter-nuhr-habe-islam-diskussion-nicht-gewollt |website=[[Neue Osnabrücker Zeitung]]|date=26 October 2014}}</ref> He is not interested in insulting Muslims, but still wants to deal critically with Islam, he told the [[Welt am Sonntag]].<ref>{{cite news|last1=Mohr|first1=Reinhard|title=Herr Nuhr, sind Sie ein islamophober Hassprediger?|url=https://www.welt.de/politik/deutschland/article133657850/Herr-Nuhr-sind-Sie-ein-islamophober-Hassprediger.html |website=[[Die Welt]]|date=26 October 2014}}</ref> The cabaret artist warned of not publicly criticizing Islam just because of fearing the possible reactions and to not leave the protest only to the right-wingers.<ref name=Hamburger>{{cite news|title=Dieter Nuhr von Muslimen als Hassprediger beleidigt|url=http://www.abendblatt.de/vermischtes/promi-news/article133670541/Dieter-Nuhr-von-Muslimen-als-Hassprediger-beleidigt.html |website=[[Hamburger Abendblatt]]|date=26 October 2014}}</ref> Nuhr, on his part, criticized the report of the Neue Osnabrücker Zeitung, which related the term “hate preacher-image” to Nuhr in their online issue. The Tagesspiegel cited Nuhr’s entry from his Facebook site: “Been accused as “hate preacher” by Islamists because I quoted the Quran correctly. Begging for regular visits in jail! Neue Osnabrücker Zeitung only asks for the opinion of the Islamists and shows understanding. The question is: Does a country, that has that kind of newspapers, even need Islamists?”<ref name=Andreas /> Richard Herzinger comments that there were some concerns and that the complaint would especially harm the image of Muslims.<ref name=Herziner>{{cite news|last1=Herzinger|first1=Richard|title=Klage gegen Nuhr schadet nur den Muslimen selbst|url=https://www.welt.de/debatte/kommentare/article133639936/Klage-gegen-Dieter-Nuhr-schadet-den-Muslimen-selbst.html |website=[[Die Welt]]|date=24 October 2014}}</ref> On 5 November 2014, the Prosecution Office of Osnabrück announced that the proceedings against Nuhr would be closed. The prosecution justified this with the lack of “xenophobic sentiment” in the works of Dieter Nuhr as well as the circumstance, that it obviously is satire.<ref>{{cite web|last1=Schölermann|first1=Stefan|title=Verfahren gegen Dieter Nuhr eingestellt|url=http://www.ndr.de/nachrichten/niedersachsen/osnabrueck_emsland/Verfahren-gegen-Dieter-Nuhr-eingestellt,dieternuhr112.html |website=[[Norddeutscher Rundfunk|NDR]]|accessdate=5 November 2014}}</ref> [[File:Dieter Nuhr, Moers 2010, CN-01.jpg|thumb|upright=1.3|Dieter Nuhr live in 2011]]
==Awards== * 1998: [[Deutscher Kleinkunstpreis]] * 2000: [[Bayerischer Kabarettpreis]] (Bavarian Cabaret Awards) and [[Morenhovener Lupe]] * 2003: [[Deutscher Comedy-Preis]]: Bester Liveact (German Comedy-Prize: best Live Act) * 2008: [[IQ Award]] * 2009/10: [[Deutscher Comedy-Preis]]: Bester Komiker (German Comedy-Prize: best comedian)
== Personal life == As of 2010, Nuhr lives in [[Ratingen]], [[North Rhine-Westphalia]].
== Productions ==
===CD albums=== Since "nur" means ''only'', ''simply'' or ''just'' in [[German language|German]], the titles of his stand-up programs and CDs often involve puns. *''Nuhr am Nörgeln'', lit. ''Nuhr grousing'' or ''Just grousing'' (1994) *''Nuhr weiter so'', lit. ''Nuhr, go on'' or ''Just going on'' (1996) *''Nuhr nach vorn'', lit. ''Nuhr, go ahead'' or ''Just going ahead'' (1998) *''www.nuhr.de'' (2000) *''www.nuhr.de/2'' (2002) *''Ich bin's Nuhr'', lit. ''It's me, Nuhr'' or ''It's just me'' (2004) *''Nuhr die Wahrheit'', lit.''Nuhr the truth'' or ''Only the truth'' (2007) *''Nuhr die Ruhe'', lit. ''Nuhr the calmness'' or ''Stay calm'' (2009)
===DVDs===
*''Quatsch Comedy Club 1&2'' *''Nuhr vom Feinsten'', lit. ''The Best Of Nuhr'' or ''Only the best''(2004) *''Ich bin's nuhr'', lit. ''It's me, Nuhr'' or ''It's just me'' (2006)
===Books===
*''Gibt es intelligentes Leben?'' lit. ''Does intelligent life exist ?'' *''Wer's glaubt, wird selig'' lit. ''Don't you believe it!''
==Literature== *{{cite web| url = http://www.spiegel.de/kultur/tv/0,1518,720077,00.html| title=Dieter Nuhr erklimmt den 'Satire Gipfel'|trans-title=Dieter Nuhr reaches 'satire peak'| language = German| date = 2010-09-28| work = Spiegel Online| accessdate = 2011-04-11}}
==References== {{reflist|30em}}
